intro: Cliffortia prionota, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cliffortia prionota is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
